definition: front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: And getting into a top tier university is the best way to ensure a good future.
sentences.chinese: 而进入一流大学则是确保锦绣前程的最好方法。

sentences.english: You are in rare form, happy, optimistic, and ready to plan your bright future.
sentences.chinese: 你现在非常积极乐观，准备规划你的锦绣前程。

sentences.english: However, under an atmosphere of apartheid a bright future not have interest in him.
sentences.chinese: 然而种族隔离氛围下的锦绣前程引不起他的兴趣。

definition: the fabled roc flies ten thousand miles (idiom)/one's future prospects are brilliant
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
glory, splendor, wealth and rank (idiom); high position and great wealth
to have a future full of promise
to win top marks in the imperial examinations
splendor shines on the family's door (idiom)/fig. to bring honor to one's family
to rapidly go up in the world/meteoric rise (of a career, social position etc)
rising straight up in a clear sky (idiom); rapid promotion to a high post/meteoric career
to bring honor to one's ancestors
to be promoted and gain wealth (idiom)
